channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attachment please find the patch that converts this issue to JUnit.
You feedback and review is appreciated.

Please note that derbyall and suites.All tests are finished without
any errors.

I'm not able to build Derby with the patch.

compile_jdbc4:
[javac] Compiling 28 source files to /export/home/kh160127/derby/trunk/classes
[javac] /export/home/kh160127/derby/trunk/java/testing/org/apache/derbyTesting/functionTests/tests/jdbc4/_Suite.java:70: cannot find symbol
[javac] symbol : variable TestResultSetMethods
[javac] location: class org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.jdbc4._Suite
[javac] suite.addTest(TestResultSetMethods.suite());
[javac] ^
[javac] Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
[javac] Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
[javac] 1 error

BUILD FAILED

Some general comments:

1) The argument order is wrong for the calls to assertEquals(). The expected value should come before the actual value.
2) The baseSuite() method could be removed, and suite() could be implemented as a simple call to TestConfiguration.defaultSuite(ResultSetMethodsTest.class).
3) There's no need for the savedAutoCommit field since each fixture gets a new connection.
4) Catching exceptions just to call fail() should be avoided as it will swallow the stack trace. The exception should rather be propagated up the call stack and handled by the JUnit framework.
5) assertEquals(...true...) and assertEquals(...false...) should be replaced with assertTrue() and assertFalse().
6) When assertSQLState() is called, there is no need to call assertNotNull(sqle.getSQLState()).

Note that there is also an existing junit test jdbc4/ResultSetTest.
I think it is a bit confusing to have two different tests with so similar names.
How should I know which one to use when adding another test case?
Has it been checked whether these two tests have overlapping test cases?

Thanks Knut for your review. I am hoping that I have addressed
all your comments in this new patch.

Your review and comments are appreciated.

Hi Oystein,

I looked at jdbc4/ResultSetTest and it looks like a different test.
How about changing jdbc4/ResultSetMethodsTest.java to
jdbc4/HoldabilityTest.java?

Thanks
Ramin

The test could use the utility methods in most test fixtures to create statement objects.

Replace

Statement s = conn.createStatement();

with

Statement s = createStatement();

e.g. in testGetHoldability().

These objects will very soon be automatically closed at tearDown and make the test more readable.

I am not sure what you mean by "looks like a different test". Any reason the two tests can not be merged?

Renaming jdbc4/ResultSetMethodsTest.java to jdbc4/HoldabilityTest.java does not seem like a good idea since the holdability test case is just one of several test cases in this test.

Thanks Dan for your review...I am attaching another patch which
I think addresses your comments. Please review....

I looked at both ResultSetTest.java and ResultSetMethodsTest.java
and they both seems to test JDBC4 methods in ResultsSet interface.
So, I merged the two tests into ResultsSetTest.java.

Please note that I added some utility methods to BaseJDBCTestCase.java:
public Statement createStatement(int resultSetType,int resultSetConcurrency,int resultSetHoldability)
public CallableStatement prepareCall(String sql, int resultSetType,int resultSetConcurrency,int resultSetHoldability)
public CallableStatement prepareCall(String sql,int resultSetType,int resultSetConcurrency)

Thanks
Ramin

Thanks Kathey for your comment.
I am attaching another patch that resolves the problem
with the earlier patch.

I appreciate your review.

Thanks
Ramin

Hi Ramin,

I am having trouble applying the patch, could you synch up, test and recreate the patch?

Thanks

Kathey

Thank you Kathey. I recreated a new patch and tested it.
I appreciate your review.

Thanks
Ramin
This was committed with revision 574053 - which I assume resolves this issue.
